meanings.definition: Capable of being dismissed from a job.
meanings.sent1: The employee's constant tardiness made them fireable.
meanings.sent2: It is important to follow company rules to avoid being considered fireable.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a fireable offense being eating all the office snacks is amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her careless actions made her a fireable liability to the company.
meanings.sent5: The warning was clear: any violation of the safety rules would make you fireable.

meanings.definition: Deserving of being terminated from employment.
meanings.sent1: The dishonest behavior of the manager was clearly fireable.
meanings.sent2: Employees who engage in unethical practices are fireable.
meanings.sent3: It's almost comical how easily some people make themselves fireable.
meanings.sent4: The company had a zero-tolerance policy for fireable offenses.
meanings.sent5: The consequences of his actions were so severe that he became instantly fireable.
